Author: SHossain#0007
Content: if you want to mine at the same address, start the daemon with `-pubkey=` option on any mining node

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: in that case, all mined funds will got to only 1 address

Author: D.rabbani#9094
Content: Thank you @SHossain

Author: SHossain#0007
Content:
```
./komodod -ac_cc=1 -ac_name=ASSETS -addressindex=1 -spentindex=1 -ac_supply=1000 -ac_reward=100000000 -pubkey=03fe754763c176e1339a3f62ee6b9484720e17ee4646b65a119e9f6370c7004abc -addnode=5.9.102.210 &
```

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: this is an example of how it may look like with pubkey

Author: D.rabbani#9094
Content: Okay so we don't have to set the -ac_perc?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: no. that was the param for that chain

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: with existing param, just add the `-pubkey=` part

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I have a chain that can only be mined by ac_pubkey address, that will be merged in later on. If thats what you were looking for.

Author: D.rabbani#9094
Content: @SHossain  can you please tell me what is the difference between rpc- bind and addnode ?

Author: D.rabbani#9094
Content: Thanks

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: `rpcbind=127.0.0.1` will bind the daemon to local node. `addnode=` is the node where you sync the chain from

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: addnode ip is primarily the ip of seednode

Content: for staking, you need to use `-genproclimit=0` or `./komodo-cli -ac_name=ANUC setgenerate true 0` because you want to use 100% stake. no normal mining needed
